info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Albany and central Rensselaer Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Green Island, or over Cohoes, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Cohoes, Watervliet, Latham, Menands, Green Island, Wyantskill, Averill Park, West Sand Lake, Center Brunswick, Wynantskill, North Greenbush, Brunswick, Sand Lake, Poestenkill, South Troy, Totem Lodge, Lansingburgh, East Poestenkill and Albia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between exits 6 and 7. Interstate 787 between exits 7 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
